Articles.Content: Hey guys, I need help because whenever I have multiple engines on a craft some of them spark or turn off during launch or in mid air flight. This isn't a bug or glitch its something wrong with my craft, but can someone tell me how I can fix this? Thanks!
Which type of engines? Jets need air intakes, they will start sparking if they run out of air.
Yeah jet engines, i have a ton of air intakes but they still spark :l
Is your craft running out of LF? Also, large amounts of jets can lose air even with copious amounts of intakes.

This may be the asymmetric flameout problem. It can show up on heavier craft with more than 2 engines. 

To test for it, remove all engines and intakes, then, replace them by alternating intake/engine, intake/engine. If this helps at all, 

See pix in [this post by LordFjord](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116993-Helpful-1-0-observations?p=1936535&viewfull=1#post1936535), he has made a mod/fix that reassigns intakes... [follow this thread for info](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104704-1-0-2-Intake-Build-Aid).

> 
> Is your craft running out of LF? Also, large amounts of jets can lose air even with copious amounts of intakes.

 What is LF?
